channel.title: The New York Times Trends
channel.description: 用中文浏览纽约时报热门报道

item.title: Stewart Rhodes, the leader of the Oath Keepers militia charged with seditious conspiracy in connection with the attack on the U.S. Capitol on Jan. 6 last year, was denied bail on Wednesday by a federal judge in Texas. https://t.co/2Z9yQ0suc6

Kobe Bryant "was going to be a bigger success off the court than on the court," the NBA legend Jerry West said, two years after his friend's death. West, who as general manager of the Lakers brought Bryant to Los Angeles, spoke to us about his grief. https://t.co/xgBa5h0ZxN

After a dazzling 40-game streak, during which she became the first woman to surpass $1 million in regular-season winnings and then the runner-up to Ken Jennings for most consecutive games won, Amy Schneider ended her “Jeopardy!” reign on Wednesday. https://t.co/0aChDEvFiI https://t.co/SCQHmctKg5

General Motors will spend $7 billion to build a battery plant in Michigan and to overhaul an existing factory outside Detroit, the company said Tuesday, saying the projects will create 4,000 jobs and help it to begin making electric pickup trucks by 2024. https://t.co/DxK5lY1ReE

Gun owners in San Jose, California, may soon be required to carry liability insurance and to pay an annual fee for safety programs intended to reduce gun violence. The proposed ordinance is believed to be the first of its kind in the U.S. https://t.co/c1bcP3Kkp5
Breaking News: After a 40-game streak, Amy Schneider’s “Jeopardy!” reign has ended. She remains the contestant with the second-most wins. https://t.co/h1WV0vzeGo
If most people started walking 10 extra minutes a day, it could prevent more than 111,000 deaths every year, according to a new study. https://t.co/CAhU0cvpjS https://t.co/6DyVy0C4KL

Prosecutors have charged 11 people with “seditious conspiracy” in the Jan. 6 Capitol attack. @AsteadWesley discusses the case and other investigations with @malachybrowne, @heytherehaley, @alanfeuer and @juliehdavis. Join us now: https://t.co/6XYx1immjV

Spotify has begun removing Neil Young’s music from its platform, the company said on Wednesday, two days after the star posted a public letter calling on Spotify to choose between him and Joe Rogan, who has been accused of spreading vaccine disinformation. https://t.co/YMKfrODbTb

Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson is among the leading candidates who could fulfill President Biden’s pledge to nominate the first Black woman to the Supreme Court, after Justice Stephen Breyer's decision to retire.
Here's what we know about her. https://t.co/Aruf5hHKB2

Justice Stephen Breyer's vacancy on the Supreme Court will give President Biden a chance to make good on his pledge to nominate a Black woman. His pick would not change the ideological balance of the court, where conservatives hold a six-vote majority. https://t.co/qZH1F79G5s https://t.co/c1Z24Y3d9T

The Justice Department is investigating the fake slates of electors that falsely declared Donald Trump the victor of the 2020 election in seven swing states that Joe Biden had in fact won, a top agency official said. https://t.co/aqExliPnEJ

Ownership of 523 acres of a redwood forest in California was returned to 10 native tribes who will serve as the land’s guardians, a conservation nonprofit said. The area was the hunting, fishing and ceremonial grounds of generations of Indigenous people. https://t.co/kG6VzSwIJ0 https://t.co/Gz0yTQI1am

Breaking News: Justice Stephen Breyer will retire from the Supreme Court, a person familiar with the decision said, giving President Biden a chance to name a new justice. Breyer, 83, is the court's oldest justice and the senior member of its liberal wing. https://t.co/UblOyAezK5

Prosecutors have charged 11 people with “seditious conspiracy” in the Jan. 6 Capitol attack. @AsteadWesley discusses the case and other investigations with @malachybrowne, @heytherehaley, @alanfeuer and @juliehdavis. Join us today at 5 p.m. ET. https://t.co/pqnVUqUXMJ

Ownership of 523 acres of a redwood forest in California was returned to 10 native tribes who will serve as the land’s guardians, a conservation nonprofit said. The area was the hunting, fishing and ceremonial grounds of generations of Indigenous people. https://t.co/NvN0f2LuwK

The Justice Department is investigating the fake slates of electors that falsely declared Donald Trump the victor of the 2020 election in seven swing states that Joe Biden had in fact won, a top agency official said. https://t.co/yyayntaaUe

A letter briefly appeared on the singer Neil Young's website asking Spotify to remove his music in protest of the platform's streaming of podcaster Joe Rogan, who has been dismissive of the coronavirus vaccine: “They can have Rogan or Young. Not both.” https://t.co/2tPYHfnEbq

Mahershala Ali, one of the most gifted actors in the U.S., has won plaudits for a string of supporting performances. Now he is stepping into the spotlight as not one but two main characters in the sci-fi drama “Swan Song.” https://t.co/EGZGTh8Gd3

David Ortiz, who led the Boston Red Sox to three World Series titles, was elected to the Baseball Hall of Fame on Tuesday. Barry Bonds and Roger Clemens failed to gain election on their final ballot. https://t.co/rQ4ecN1uUC

Cardi B was awarded $1.25 million in damages in a libel lawsuit against Tasha K, a YouTuber who posted videos in 2018 claiming that the rapper was a prostitute who had contracted sexually transmitted infections and used cocaine. https://t.co/a11lLFfEUJ
Breaking News: The U.S. plans to arrange alternative fuel sources for Europe, in case Russia cuts off gas and crude oil supplies as tensions over Ukraine continue to rise. https://t.co/QVmQVIl697

The actor Peter Dinklage said he was stunned to learn that Disney was doing a live-action remake of “Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs.” It is a "backward story of seven dwarfs living in a cave together," he said. https://t.co/gpOQA7XyAL https://t.co/MrRwBRblWd

"Here we go!"
To the soccer world, player transfer news might as well be rumor until the Italian journalist @FabrizioRomano gives his imprimatur to his followers. Has he crossed over from reporter to influencer, our soccer columnist @RorySmith asks. https://t.co/5Mt4KpYPyG

Prosecutors have charged 11 people with “seditious conspiracy” in the Jan. 6 Capitol attack. @AsteadWesley discusses the case and other investigations with @malachybrowne, @heytherehaley, @alanfeuer and @juliehdavis. Join us on Wednesday at 5 p.m. ET. https://t.co/pqnVUqUXMJ

Mahershala Ali, one of the most gifted actors in the U.S., has won plaudits for a string of supporting performances. Now he is stepping into the spotlight as not one but two main characters in the sci-fi drama “Swan Song.” https://t.co/nFgwlykgHm https://t.co/nYsezF6Y3l

Cardi B was awarded $1.25 million in damages in a libel lawsuit against Tasha K, a YouTuber who posted videos in 2018 claiming that the rapper was a prostitute who had contracted sexually transmitted infections and used cocaine. https://t.co/zJsPA4zRxv

The SAT will go completely digital by 2024 in the U.S. and be shortened from three hours to two hours, the College Board said. Students will take the college admissions exam on laptops or tablets at testing centers. https://t.co/qhosKvVPHF

A 22-year-old Kenyan man, who was found in the front wheel section of a cargo plane that landed on Sunday morning, likely boarded the plane in Nairobi, where it stopped on the way to Amsterdam from Johannesburg, a Dutch military police spokesman said. https://t.co/I01KP3NKba
A request for a special grand jury was approved in the criminal inquiry into Donald Trump’s attempts to overturn Georgia’s 2020 election results. https://t.co/aN7kgXcDCI

Three federal judges threw out Alabama’s congressional map and ordered state lawmakers to redraw the lines. “Black voters have less opportunity than other Alabamians to elect candidates of their choice to Congress,” the panel of judges wrote. https://t.co/nQOorFaZ00
Amy Schneider surpassed Matt Amodio's 38-game streak on "Jeopardy!" on Monday. She now has the second-highest number of consecutive wins in the show's history. https://t.co/ZX95IMEK9w

A Connecticut financial adviser lost his job at Merrill Lynch after he was seen on video throwing a smoothie at a shop worker and calling her an "immigrant loser." His lawyer said he was upset after his son had a severe allergic reaction to a drink. https://t.co/LrCbF31cik

President Biden directed an under-the-breath expletive on Monday toward Peter Doocy, the White House correspondent for Fox News, that was amplified by a live microphone onto screens around the world. https://t.co/uI0CbEIry7

In a major pivot for the Biden administration, 8,500 American troops have been put on “high alert” for possible deployment to Eastern Europe, the Pentagon said on Monday, as NATO and the U.S. brace for a possible Russian invasion of Ukraine. https://t.co/YbSYiPdQIV
Breaking News: Seven Virginia school districts filed a lawsuit over Gov. Glenn Youngkin’s executive order to make masks optional in public schools. https://t.co/1hLw4ZiX78

Elio’s, a restaurant in Manhattan, said it was investigating after Sarah Palin, who's not vaccinated against the coronavirus, dined indoors there on Saturday despite a city vaccine mandate. She tested positive for the virus on Monday. https://t.co/cuzmsUiKLX
Breaking News: Cash payments for low-income mothers increased brain function in babies, a study found, with potential implications for U.S. safety net policy. https://t.co/CPi24odr48
Breaking News: The Webb telescope reached its final stop a million miles from Earth, and will now prepare to study light from the beginning of time. https://t.co/YK3oTLhiKL https://t.co/Kv4MmTf6a2

Surgery to remove cataracts, which cause the eye’s normally clear lens to become cloudy, can restore vision almost instantaneously. But new research suggests it may have another benefit: a reduced risk for Alzheimer’s disease and other forms of dementia. https://t.co/bJDTmyfG5F

Sarah Palin has tested positive for the coronavirus, forcing the delay of her defamation trial against The New York Times, which was set to begin with jury selection on Monday morning. Palin is not vaccinated, the judge in the case said. https://t.co/K1pGU14Oo5

Thierry Mugler, the genre-busting French designer who dominated European runways in the late 1980s and early ’90s, died on Sunday at 73. He was one of the main architects of an aesthetic that married S&M and high fashion. https://t.co/jvaeCdLCQ8 https://t.co/AlN4dnm2lm

Ukraine has a plan to defend an invasion of Chernobyl, one of the most radioactive places on earth. “We don’t know what will kill us first, the virus, radiation or war,” said a resident with a shrug. https://t.co/JbSBn8dja6

Timothy Heaphy, the top staff investigator on the House committee investigating the Jan. 6 attack on the Capitol, has been fired by the state’s new Republican attorney general from his position as the top lawyer for the University of Virginia. https://t.co/2zXJ312BSr
For an exhausted group of mothers in Boston, the pandemic had been so draining that they just wanted to scream. So they did. https://t.co/6oaO3EGjKG https://t.co/Z5DIoULSJg

In Opinion
"This time, Mr. Putin’s aim is bigger than closing NATO’s 'open door' to Ukraine and taking more territory — he wants to evict the United States from Europe," writes Fiona Hill, who served as national intelligence officer for Russia and Eurasia.https://t.co/14zNmqhZjs

President Biden is considering deploying several thousand U.S. troops, as well as warships and aircraft, to NATO allies in the Baltics and Eastern Europe amid fears of a Russian incursion into Ukraine. https://t.co/uQrFEaz9zX
Thierry Mugler, the genre-busting French designer who dominated European runways in the late 1980s and early 1990s, died. He was 73. https://t.co/jE2iJXHjLi

As more vaccinated people are infected with Omicron, they may build “hybrid” immunity, which is what scientists call the combined protection of pre-existing vaccine antibodies and natural antibodies from a breakthrough infection.https://t.co/9YZNYqHzwO
Here’s how to use those bananas browning on your countertop. https://t.co/J6oEUxxyCq https://t.co/oTP9TWYXj0
